title: ‘Alexander Calder: Modern From the Start’ Review: Artist, Engineer, Giant
sub_head: A striking exhibition at MoMA celebrates the sculptor and his long association with the museum, in work that ranges from his inventive jewelry to his massive mobiles.
body:
New York
The opening gallery of the Museum of Modern Art’s “Alexander Calder: Modern From the Start,” which hosts a modest, black-and-white installation of seven abstractions, is absolutely stunning. Playful, muscular, fantastical and serene, it’s among the most striking gatherings of Calder’s art I have ever seen.
